intro: Phyllanthus lindenianus var. jimenezii, commonly known as the Jimenez's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to dry conditions, making it resilient to drought. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
